title: Manchester United hoping to make eight new signings in next two summers
text:
Manchester United plan to sign eight new players over the next two summer transfer windows as they prepare to launch a major overhaul of their squad.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side have had a woeful start to the season and currently sit 15 points behind leaders Liverpool already after just eight matches.

United find themselves particularly short of attacking options and lack the squad depth to compete with Liverpool and Manchester City, as their current injury crisis has proven in recent weeks.

Manchester United plan to sign eight new players over the next two summer transfer windows

Leicester duo Ben Chilwell and James Maddison have been linked with moves to Old Trafford

However, according to The Telegraph, the Red Devils are well aware of their need to improve their playing staff and will make a number of signings over the next two summers.

One of those incomings could be brought forward to January too amid growing concern that a challenge for Champions League football could already be on the rocks.

It is claimed the club believe they are 'six players short of challenging for major honours' and the overhaul of players will be led by Solskjaer, who still has the full backing of the club.

'Ole is looking at a three-year vision of a squad. It will be an evolution over the coming years,' a Telegraph source said. 'We are at base camp now.'

United spent big on British talent this summer, welcoming Harry Magurie, Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Dan James.

The club will continue their recent preference of signing younger players but they insist they are not limiting themselves to solely British talent.

United spent big on British talent this summer, welcoming Harry Magurie among others

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side are 15 points off leaders Liverpool after a poor start to the season

Rostov midfielder Mathias Normann is reportedly one of those attracting United's interest while Leicester duo James Maddison and Ben Chilwell are also considered to be targets.

Benfica defender Ruben Dias is also on United's radar while reports this week suggested an exchange deal of Emre Can and Mario Mandzukic for Paul Pogba could be agreed with Juventus.

The Telegraph also report that United still want to appoint a technical director to oversee the club's transfer business and steer the long-term vision.

Nobody has been approached yet but it will reportedly be a former player or someone who can quickly grasp the club's need for immediate success.

Reports suggest there is a willingness to accept United have left themselves short up front following the failure to land a replacement for either Alexis Sanchez or Romelu Lukaku.

Discussions were held about signing a new forward but Solskjaer wanted to give Anthony Martial a chance up front as well as give more opportunities to Marcus Rashford and youngster Mason Greenwood.
